data.title: UTN wants stiffer fraud sentences
data.description: The United Thai Nation (UTN) Party will propose amending the law to limit the Corrections Department

data.title: Investors cry foul at 'clean energy scam'
data.description: A group of 20 people yesterday petitioned the Economic Crime Suppression Division (ECD) of the police

data.title: Kingdom ranks 8th on global 'rich heritage' list
data.description: Thailand is ranked eighth among 89 countries with the richest cultural heritage in the world, according to a report by US News & World.

data.title: Low orders force factories to lay off 2,600 employees
data.description: About 2,600 factory workers have been laid off over the past two days as their employers were forced to scale down operations due to financial problems.

data.title: Group seeks Trang airport resolution
data.description: A civic group in the southern province of Trang is petitioning the Ministry of Transport to speed up its handling of a construction problem at Trang airport which the group believes is to blame for a drop in the number of air passengers and a hike in air ticket prices.

data.title: No Brics membership for kingdom yet
data.description: Thailand has not yet been confirmed as a member of the Brics international organisation, according to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA).

data.title: Holiday influx at border
data.description: Thailand

data.title: PM says she's feeling better
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra took to social media yesterday to thank the public for their support during her recovery from bronchitis, saying she was feeling better.

data.title: Migrant decision stirs fury
data.description: The government has defended its decision to grant Thai citizenship to migrants and members of ethnic minorities, saying the policy is in line with the law.

data.title: Thai Airways cancels Taipei flights as typhoon strikes
data.description: Thai Airways International suspended three flights to and from Taipei on Thursday and one on Friday due to the approach of Typhoon Kong-rey.

data.title: Cooler weather a few more days away
data.description: The  cool season  is forecast to start in much of the country after Nov 9, when the mercury is expected to drop by 1â€“2 degrees Celsius in Bangkok, according to the Thai Meteorological Department.

data.title: Bhumjaithai seeks to preserve local positions
data.description: The Bhumjaithai Party has submitted two bills aimed at preserving the positions of village and sub-district headmen in municipalities, saying they are needed to facilitate effective work with residents.

data.title: New border checkpoint opens in Sa Kaeo
data.description: Thailand and Cambodia have opened the Thai-Cambodian Friendship Bridge permanent  border checkpoint  in Sa Kaeo province, and also extended the hours at the Chong Sa-ngam checkpoint in Si Sa Ket province to boost trade and tourism.

data.title: Thai territory bordering Cambodia is safe, says government
data.description: The government denied taking action regarding Koh Kut in Trat province while assuring the public that Thailand would not lose it to Cambodia.

data.title: 483,000 to be granted citizenship
data.description: The cabinet has approved a policy to grant Thai citizenship to over 483,000 migrants and members of ethnic minorities who have lived in Thailand long-term or were born in the kingdom.

data.title: AoT reports rising air traffic
data.description: The country

data.title: Bangkok offers incentives for rubbish sorters
data.description: Bangkok

data.title: Man hit, killed by train in southern Thailand
data.description: SURAT THANI - A 45-year-old man was found dead after being struck by the Trang-Bangkok express train in this southern province on Wednesday, a day before his housewarming ceremony.

data.title: Baby steps on road to joining Organisation for Economic Co-operation
data.description: Thailand hopes to join the  Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development  (OECD) as it sees rising opportunities from a  strategic convergence  between the two, according to Foreign Minister Maris Sangiampongsa.

data.title: Thai Airways cancels Taipei flights as Taiwan prepares for Typhoon Kong-rey
data.description: Thai Airways International suspended three flights to and from Taipei on Thursday and one on Friday due to the approach of Typhoon Kong-rey.

data.title: Vietnam jails blogger snatched from Thailand
data.description: A Vietnamese  blogger  who was reportedly  abducted  from Thailand last year has been sentenced to 12 years in prison for disseminating anti-party and anti-state content, according to local media reports.
